attributes.action: Not to use tax payers money to fund renovation  works at Frogmore Cottage.
attributes.additional_details:
Money could be utilised for social housing.
Abolish Universal credit introduce a welfare system that looks after those in need.
Ensure all generations are able to receive their pensions
at 60.
attributes.background:
Money would be better spent on helping the homeless ,helping people out of poverty reducing usage of food banks .

Allowing the 50s women to have their state pensions as promised .

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Sovereign Grant is paid annually to the monarch by the Government in order to fund the Monarch's official duties. The monarchy is responsible for deciding how to spend the Sovereign Grant and so the UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for making these spending decisions. 

You can find out more about the grant here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/sovereign-grant-act-2011-guidance/sovereign-grant-act-2011-guidance

You could start a new petition asking for a reduction in the Sovereign Grant, if that is something you would like to see happen.
